sections.title: DataGrid Examples
sections.content:
If we have an GraphQL query injection like this

class ExampleScope
{
    @observable
    foos = injection(
        // language=GraphQL
        `query iQueryFoo($config: QueryConfigInput!)
        {
            iQueryFoo(config: $config)
            {
                type
                columnStates{
                    name
                    enabled
                    sortable
                }
                queryConfig{
                    id
                    condition
                    currentPage
                    pageSize
                    sortOrder{
                        fields
                    }
                }
                rows{
                    id
                    name
                    num
                    owner{
                        id
                        login
                    }
                    
                }
                rowCount
            }
        }`,
        {
            "config": {
                "pageSize": 20
            }
        }
    );
}

You can use a DataGrid component like this

    <DataGrid
        value={ scope.foos }
    >
        <DataGrid.Column
            heading={ "Action" }
        >
            {
                foo => (
                    <Button
                        className="btn btn-secondary text-nowrap"
                        icon="fa-edit"
                        text="Detail"
                        action={ () => alert("Button for " + JSON.stringify(foo)) }
                    />
                )
            }
        </DataGrid.Column>
        <DataGrid.Column name="name" filter="containsIgnoreCase"/>
        <DataGrid.Column name="num" filter="eq"/>
        <DataGrid.Column name="owner.login" filter="containsIgnoreCase" />
    </DataGrid>

The columns render the scalar value when being self-closing and being given a field name.

Otherwise you can use a render function to render content. The render function receives the current row object as only argument.

Simple filter comparisons can be given with the filter attribute.

The standard iQuery implementation is able to follow "to One" relations of object and request those with a single joined SQL query.

Here we follow a relation named owner to a corresponding AppUser object and display owner.login as column.

sections.title: Custom Filter
sections.content:
A client-side custom filter can be defined by giving a function to filter.

<DataGrid.Column
    heading={ i18n("Sum") }
    filter={ (min,max) => (
        field("numa")
            .add(
                field(
                    "numb"
                )
            )
            .between(
                value(
                    "Int",
                    min
                ),
                value(
                    "Int",
                    max
                )
            )
    ) }
>
{
    (row) => row.sumA + row.sumB
}


The function can have one or more arguments.


</DataGrid.Column>

sections.title: Tree-Navigation
sections.content:
The tree can be used with both mouse and keyboard.

The care-buttons open and close tree groups and load additional data on demand.

Clicking on the name of the item executes the default action or first action in the actions definition.

( See Tree.Objects and Tree.IndexedObjects )

The context-menu can be opened by right-clicking the name or combining a normal click with either ctrl, shift or alt.

sections.title: Keyboard navigation
sections.content:
With the keyboard the menu can be opened by either pressing ctrl, shift or alt while pressing the return key or by tabbing onto a visually hidden context menu button with opens the same menu.

Navigation within the tree works via cursor keys. Up and Down move the selection one item up or down. 'Home' and 'End' key select the first or last item in the tree.

Cursor left closes the current tree group or jumps to the current parent if the group is already closed or the item has no descendants.

Cursor right opens the current tree group or jumps to the first descendant if the group is already open.

description.description: Displays the currently associated entities of a many-to-many relationship as seen from one of the associated sides.

reactDocGen.description: Displays the currently associated entities of a many-to-many relationship as seen from one of the associated sides.

display.description: Path to use as display value for associations or render function for associations ( linkObj => ReactElement ).

value.description: Path to use as the representative value / id of the link

query.description: iQuery GraphQL query to fetch the current list of target objects

queryCondition.description: Optional FilterDSL condition to be applied to the execution of the AssociationSelector's query

modalTitle.description: Title for the modal dialog selecting the target object

name.description:
Name / path for the association selector field. In contrast to most normal fields this does not point
to a scalar value but to list of associative entity / link table fields with embedded target objects

mode.description: Mode for this calendar field. If not set or set to null, the mode will be inherited from the <Form/> or <FormBlock>.

helpText.description: Additional help text for this field. Is rendered for non-erroneous fields in place of the error.

label.description: Label for the field. Must be defined if name is missing.

labelClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the label element.

formGroupClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the form group element.

fade.description: Whether to do the modal fade animation on selection (default is true)

generateId.description:
Function to return a new id value for newly created associations. Note that you can use placeholder id values.

Default is to create a new UUID (NPM "uuid" v4).

onNew.description:
Optional callback function that is called for every newly created association link and allows to modify
properties on that new link. ( link => ... )

disabled.description:
Disables the AssociationSelector.
Can be defined as callback function.

alignPagination.description: set the pagination alignment of the datagrid in the modal ("left" [default], "center", "right")

paginationPageSizes.description: set the available page sizes for the datagrid pagination

description.description:
Attachment form field allowing the user to upload attachments and remove attachments.

Storage of the attachments has to be done with the Attachments API.

reactDocGen.description:
Attachment form field allowing the user to upload attachments and remove attachments.

Storage of the attachments has to be done with the Attachments API.

name.description: Name / path for this field (e.g. "name", but also "foos.0.name")

deleteRemoved.description: If true, delete removed attachments from the database, otherwise just de-reference them. (default is true)

mode.description: Mode for this field. If not set or set to null, the mode will be inherited from the <Form/> or <FormBlock>.

helpText.description:
Additional help text for this field. Is rendered for non-erroneous fields in place of the error. If a function
is given, it should be a stable reference ( e.g. with useCallback()) to prevent creating the field context over
and over. The same considerations apply to using elements. ( The expression <Bla/> recreates that element on every
invocation, use static element references)

tooltip.description: Tooltip / title attribute for the input element

labelClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the label element.

formGroupClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the form group element.

addons.description:
Array of addons as props instead of as children. Only useful if you're writing a component wrapping Field and want
to render your addons as field addons while using the render function form.

onChange.description: Optional local on-change handler ( ({oldValue, fieldContext}, value) => ... )

description.description: Renders a link to an attachment

reactDocGen.description: Renders a link to an attachment

className.description: Additional HTML classes for the attachment link.

disabled.description: True if the attachment link should be disabled

methods.name: disabledIfErrors

returns.description: true if the button should be disabled

methods.description:
Convenience method to have a non-transition button that is disabled when there are errors in the form. Makes sure
to submit the form /revalidate the form context before deciding.

It follows the behavior of transition discard buttons and disables if there is either an error in the form or if the
button is inside a form, but there is no form object.

transition.description: Transition reference. button must have either a `transition` or an `action` attribute.

disabled.description:
Additional function to check for disabled status. The default behavior is to disable the button if the button has
a transition which is not discarding and there are form errors.

This check runs before that and can disable the button in any case.

context.description:
Explicitly sets the button context to the given object. If no context is given, the form base object of the surrounding
form is used.

action.description: Optional action function, receives the context as argument

type.description: the type of the button, defaults to "button"

minDate.description: Minimum date the user can select

maxDate.description: Maximum date the user can select

name.description: Name / path for the  calendar field value (e.g. "name", but also "foos.0.name")

mode.description: Mode for this calendar field. If not set or set to null, the mode will be inherited from the <Form/> or <FormBlock>.

helpText.description:

is given, it should be a stable reference ( e.g. with useCallback()) to prevent creating the field context over
and over. The same considerations apply to using elements. ( The expression <Bla/> recreates that element on every
invocation, use static element references)

Create a Column, that can be expanded/collapsed.

This component is supposed to be used inside a flex layout (like bootstraps grid system)

collapsedLabelText.description: The text shown, if the element is collapsed

maxWidth.description:
the upper boundary that will be used for drag resizing\
allowed units: px, vw, vh\
defaults to 400px

minWidth.description:
the lower boundary that will be used for drag resizing\
allowed units: px, vw, vh\
defaults to 100px

width.description:
the initial width, that will be used if the device is at least a medum size device\
allowed units: px, vw, vh\
defaults to 200px

tableClassName.description: Additional classes to set on the table element. (default is "table-hover table-striped table-bordered")

rowClasses.description: Function to produce additional classes for each row ( context => classes )

filterTimeout.description:
Timeout in milliseconds for the filter inputs. The actual update of the filter will be delayed until this many
milliseconds have passed since the last filter change.

isCompact.description:
use compact datagrid mode where by defaul all colums use minimal space (except for the last)
and enhanced size parameters are enabled per column

workingSet.description: Working set with in-memory objects to be mixed in

moveRowColumn.description:
The column used for manually sorting rows.
The column must contain number values.
It will be rendered in front of all other columns and a grabber icon is renddered instead of the value.

paginationPageSizes.description: set the available page sizes for the pagination

precision.description: Numerical precision for big decimal fields. (e.g. 123.45 has a scale of 5)

domainType.description: Domain type of the entity to show activity for

version.description: Version of the entity if used together with merging. Prevents false-positive changes

description.description:
Simplified Dropdown Menu component with a local open state handling.

Simply wrap Buttons or DropdownItems in this component.

reactDocGen.description:
Simplified Dropdown Menu component with a local open state handling.

Simply wrap Buttons or DropdownItems in this component.

text.description:
Optional text or render function to change the labeling of the dropdown button.
Default is a vertical ellipsis icon.

title.description: Optional title to change the tooltip of the dropdown button.

inline.description: Optional inline mode switch for the dropdown button to not be floated to the right.

description.description:
Addon button to invoke meta functionality to configure the current mask. Detects the surrounding field / process / view
and invokes a subprocess with those parameters.

reactDocGen.description:
Addon button to invoke meta functionality to configure the current mask. Detects the surrounding field / process / view
and invokes a subprocess with those parameters.

subProcess.description: Subprocess to call from the button. Will receive the input parameters "processName", "state", and "fieldName".

icon.description: Icon to use for the button. Default is fa-cog.

label.description: Text to use for the button. Default is `i18n("Configure Field")`

mini.description: If false, use label in button, otherwise just use aria-label

dialogOptions.description: Process dialog options for the invoked subprocess.

description.description:
Renders the current value of foreign key references and allows changing of references via text-input and selection from
modal grid.

reactDocGen.description:
Renders the current value of foreign key references and allows changing of references via text-input and selection from
modal grid.

display.description: Property to use as display value or render function for the current value  ( formConfig => ReactElement ). Can be used to extend on simple property rendering.

query.description: iQuery GraphQL query to fetch the current list of target objects or iQuery document containing all values

queryCondition.description: Optional FilterDSL condition to be applied to the execution of the FKSelector's query

modalTitle.description: Title for the modal dialog selecting the target object

name.description: Name / path for the  foreign key value (e.g. "name", but also "foos.0.name").

mode.description: Mode for this foreign key selector. If not set or set to null, the mode will be inherited from the <Form/> or <FormBlock>.

modalFilter.description: Filter mode for the selector modal. Controls display of column and repeated search filter in interaction with the searchFilter prop,

helpText.description:
Additional help text for this field. Is rendered for non-erroneous fields in place of the error. If a function
is given, it should be a stable reference ( e.g. with useCallback()) to prevent creating the field context over
and over. The same considerations apply to using elements. ( The expression <Bla/> recreates that element on every
invocation, use static element references)

tooltip.description: Tooltip / title attribute for the input element

label.description: Label for the field. Must be defined if name is missing.

inputClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the display value.

labelClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the label element.

formGroupClass.description: Additional HTML classes for the form group element.

fade.description: Whether to do the modal fade animation on selection (default is true)

autoFocus.description: True to focus the fk selector input (See `searchFilter` )

searchFilter.description:
Field name or function returning a filter expression used to allow and
validate text-input changes of the selected value.

The field or filter must match exactly one element from the current `query`.

(Function must be of the form `value => ...` and must return a Filter DSL condition.)

searchTimeout.description: Timeout in ms after which the input will do the validation query ( default: 350).

cachedPageSize.description: Page size to use when using an in-memory iQuery document as data source. (Default is 5)

validateAsync.description: Optional async validation handler ( (ctx, value) => Promise<error(s)> ).

onChange.description: Optional extended local on-change handler ({oldValue, oldRow, row, fieldContext)}, value => ...)

visibleColumns.description:
Optional override for visible columns definition.

By default every column returned by the query is visible.
The FKSelector then checks for a "fkSelektorVisibleColumns" definition in the type metadata to filter out unneeded columns.

This property overrides the type metadata value for a single FKSelector field.

alignPagination.description: set the pagination alignment of the datagrid in the modal ("left" [default], "center", "right")

paginationPageSizes.description: set the available page sizes for the datagrid pagination

description.description:
Special automaton link that can do process changes within the current page context.

You can use it like a normal link and if the URI patterns match, it will do its magic thing and otherwise
it will just be a link.

description.description: Snapshots the y-position of the currently focused form element, if there is such an element
Restores the previous y-position of the focused form element if the position changed while the errors also changed.

Create a form section

This component registers the section to the shortcut context

Create a form section

This component registers the section to the shortcut context

id.description: the id of the resulting html element

icon.description:
the icon used for the shortcut link

can either be a fontawesome key or a render function

heading.description: the header of the section and also the tooltip of the shortcut link

headingRenderer.description: defines how the header of the section is rendered, default is a render as h2

hideHeader.description: if set to true, the card header will be set to be visible for screenreaders only

formContext.description:
the used FormContext
defaults to the default FormContext

collapsible.description: defines if this section is collapsible or not

initiallyCollapsed.description:
if the section is collapsible, defines if it is initially collapsed or not
has no effect if the section is not collapsible
